env-entry.description: The WADO endpoint URL. The WADO request parameters will be appended to the end of this (including the '?').
The maximum number of processes that will be run at once. May be set to 0 (or any negative number) to allow any number to run at once.

Path to the directory containing the JAR files required to run the image processor. All JARs in that path will be used. If not specified, the /WEB-INF/processor-lib directory will be used, assuming it can be discovered.
The path to the MATLAB runtime (or a MATLAB installation). If left blank, the MCRROOT environment variable will be used.
The URL to send the processed DICOM to. If left blank, nothing will be uploaded.
The URL to callback once a run has completed. If left blank, no response will be sent.
The location to store temporary files. If left blank, a temporary directory will be created at startup and files will be stored there.
